オプション1: Star Man was heading to the Virtual Bex Port Ruins.

It was too far for a day trip, and camping out was necessary,
so he had brought gear for that.
He saw the Virtual Bex Port Ruins in the distance. No one was there.
(If possible, I don't want to meet the one called Nes.)
Cautiously, Star Man entered Virtual Bex.
In a house's storeroom, Star Man found a round ball.

(I don't know what it's called, but fishermen use these a lot.
If I attach them, it should raise the raft's durability.)
Star Man picked up a buoy.
(There's a limit to how many I can carry at once...)
The Virtual Bex Port Ruins were deserted, but there were signs of people.
<CLACK>
There was a sound from somewhere.
When he nervously went that way, someone seemed to be hiding.
"Someone there...?"
No reply.
"Oooooooo..."
A ghost appeared from another direction. The ghost was enormously fat.
(Matches the description of Noble that Trapezoid Man gave...)
The ghost floated closer.

(Do I run without fighting...?
But I want to come here again and again to collect boat materials...)

The ghost he'd fought before had clearly meant to attack.
This one seemed to be drawing near only out of base impulse.
(I don't sense any magical attack coming...)
The ghost moved slowly; as long as he walked, it wouldn't catch up.
<BWOO>

Star Man summoned black flames and hurled them at the foe.
The ghost stopped and stared at the flames.
When the flames touched the ghost, it burst into flame.
The ghost writhed and seemed to be in pain.
Star Man watched a while, and the ghost simply burned out and vanished.
"Aww, you went and killed it (laughs)."
There was a grinning man—skinny, with legs trembling.
"Are you the man named Nes?"

"Nope! That's not me (laughs). Who's that even (laughs)?
Never heard of such a person (laughs)."
The man straightened his collar.
"Tell me your name."
"Well now. No idea. I forgot it (laughs)."
"Was the ghost you just took down the man named Noble?"
"Beats me (laughs). Was there someone like that (laughs)?"
The man popped his collar and then fixed it again.
"What are you doing here?"
"Oh, uh—robbery‑murder (laughs)."
"Robbery‑murder?"

"Yup, killed e‑veryone who was around here,
stripped them of their money, chopped up the bodies,
and buried them (laughs). Ahh, it was the best (laughs)."

Star Man looked around, but it was a ruin decades old—
a far cry from a grisly crime scene.
"You killed a man named Noble and robbed him?"
"Yup yup (laughs)."
"Are you going to stab me? If you are, say so first (laughs)."
"If you're that dangerous, I can't let you live."
Star Man raised his stone axe.

"C'mon, obviously I'm joking (laughs).
You're kinda weird, you know that (laughs)?"

"People must hate you a lot (laughs).
Don't folks tell you you're too thick to talk to (laughs)?"
"...(laughs)"
The man looked at Star Man with a smug smile, triumphant.
"Back to the start—are you 'Nes'?"
"Ehh? Who's 'Nes' supposed to be (laughs)?"
"Then what's your name?"

"Hey now, shouldn't you introduce yourself first (laughs)?
Why do I gotta be the only one to tell you (laughs)?"
"I'm Star Man."

"Star Man, huh? Never heard such a dumb name before (laughs).
Your parents are totally *** right (laughs)? Wee‑woo, wee‑woo (laughs)."
"So what's your name?"
"Eh (laughs)? Why should I tell you (laughs)?"

"We never agreed to that (laughs). You're the one who blurted yours out (laughs).
Oh, I remembered—my name's Star Man (laughs)."
"Man, what a weird name (laughs). It's been rough (laughs)."
"Well then... I'll get out of your hair."
Star Man turned and started walking toward Precision.
(So every time I come here I might run into this guy...)

"Aww, finally gone (laughs).
Whew, I'm tired of dealing with *** (laughs).
Saved me there (laughs). Take care now (laughs)!"
Star Man ignored him and kept walking.
"Ah! Someone's stealing the buoys!"
Star Man stopped in his tracks.
"Aw, come on, that's a problem."
"How is it a problem?"
"I need them for a mass killing (laughs)."
"These? How would you use them for mass murder?"

"Nope, can't tell you that (laughs).
Why should I tell *** like you (laughs)?"
"Where the hell did the idea I'm *** come from?"

"C'mon, your parents are *** right (laughs)?
So as their kid you're *** too (laughs).
You're literally stealing our buoys (laughs)."

"We could use them to kill your parents, too (laughs).
When lots of people die, it's the best (laughs)."

At last the man clutched his stomach and sat down on the ground.
He kicked his feet and slapped the ground, laughing.
Star Man left the Virtual Bex Port Ruins.

(There are people who burst out laughing at funerals.
I hadn't run into one for a while—I'd forgotten...)

Star Man wasn't trembling from anger or fear,
but from the shock of encountering the unknown.
